channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Countable dense homogeneity and topological groups
item.description: arXiv:2501.09455v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Building on results of Medvedev, we construct a $\mathsf{ZFC}$ example of a non-Polish topological group that is countable dense homogeneous. Our example is a dense subgroup of $\mathbb{Z}^\omega$ of size $\mathfrak{b}$ that is a $\lambda$-set. We also conjecture that every countable dense homogenous Baire topological group with no isolated points contains a copy of the Cantor set, and give a proof in a very special case.
item.dc:creator: Claudio Agostini, Andrea Medini, Lyubomyr Zdomskyy

item.title: Assouad type dimensions of homogeneous Moran sets and Cantor-like sets
item.description: arXiv:2407.14837v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper, we give the Assouad dimension formula and the upper bound of the lower dimension for homogeneous Moran sets under the condition $\sup_{k\ge 1}\{n_{k}\}<+\infty$. We also give the Assouad spectrum and the lower spectrum formulas for Cantor-like sets.
item.dc:creator: Yanzhe Li, Jun Li, Shuang Liang, Manli Lou
